com.pb.sawdust.util.concurrent

Class IteratorAction<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask<java.util.Iterator<B>>
      • com.pb.sawdust.util.concurrent.IteratorTask<A,java.lang.Void>
        • com.pb.sawdust.util.concurrent.IteratorAction<A>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Void>, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Void>>

    public class IteratorAction<A>
extends IteratorTask<A,java.lang.Void>
    The IteratorAction class provides an IteratorTask for transfer functions which do not return values. The resultant iterator is used to ensure that all tasks have been completed; other than that, it is not used (it holds no values/results).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void waitForCompletion()
      Convenience method to wait for all of the tasks submitted by this task (to a ForkJoinPool) to complete.
